documents.document_content_text: *Unknown;    bmk    Plan  of Care by by Ball, Lucille, RN at 02/28/23 1605            Author: Ball, Lucille, RN Service:  Author Type: Registered Nurse       Filed: 02/28/23 1606 Status: Signed      Editor: Ball, Lucille, RN (Registered Nurse)        Pt alert and oriented to person, place, time, and situation. Denies pain and shortness of breath.~VSS. Intake and output monitored and documented. ~Up ad lib. Right radial cath  site dressing CDI. Call light and urinal within reach.~Comfort rounds provided.       Problem: Adult Inpatient Plan of Care  Goal: Plan of Care Review  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing  Goal: Patient-Specific Goal (Individualized)  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing  Goal: Absence of Hospital-Acquired Illness or Injury  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing  Goal: Optimal Comfort and Wellbeing  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing  Goal: Readiness for Transition of Care  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: High Fall Risk  Goal: High Risk (HDS score >/= 15)  Description: Patient will:     Remain as independent as possible.   Have lower fall risk.   Have lower injury risk.    Remain safe from fall and injury   Patient / Family will:   Understand fall prevention measures   Understand injury reduction measures   Comply with fall program   Verbalize fall prevention strategies to implement  after discharge  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: Peter Parker Medication  Goal: Decrease risk to fall secondary to Medication issues.  Description: Patient will:   Be compliant with medication regimen.   Call for assistance before getting up.   Dangle prior  to getting OOB.Patient and family will:   Verbalize understanding of medication regimen and its effects on risk for falling.   Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: Peter Parker Toileting  Goal: Decrease risk to fall secondary to Toileting issues.  Description: Patient and Family will:   Verbalize understanding of toileting program.   Demonstrate proper use of assistive devices.    Call for assist when having toileting needs.  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: Peter Parker Volume/Electrolyte Status  Goal: Decrease risk to fall secondary to Volume and/or Electrolyte Status issues.  Description: Patient will:   Maintain adequate PO intake when possible.   Ambulate safely with IV pole.Patient and  family will:   Verbalize understanding of maintaining proper hydration.   Verbalize signs/symptoms of hypo and hyperglycemia.   Describe interventions for preventing dehydration.  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: Peter Parker Communication/Sensory  Goal: Decrease risk to fall secondary to Communication/Sensory issues.  Description: Patient will:   Be able to communicate with family and caregivers through alternative measures.   Have access to  assistive devices when needed.  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: Diabetes Comorbidity  Goal: Blood Glucose Level Within Targeted Range  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: Heart Failure Comorbidity  Goal: Maintenance of Heart Failure Symptom Control  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: Hypertension Comorbidity  Goal: Blood Pressure in Desired Range  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing     Problem: Mobility Impairment  Goal: Optimal Mobility  Outcome: Ongoing, Progressing              bmk

reduction measures\line    Comply with fall program\line    Verbalize fall prevention strategies to implement after discharge\par regimen.\line    Call for assistance before getting up.\line    Dangle prior to getting OOB.\line\line Patient and family will:\line    Verbalize understanding of medication regimen and its effects on risk for falling.\line  \par \li250\ql\plain\f0\fs24\plain\f2\fs22\lang1033\hich\f2\dbch\f2\loch\f2\cf5\fs22 Outcome: \plain\f2\fs22\lang1033\hich\f2\dbch\f2\loch\f2\cf6\fs22 Ongoing, Progressing\par
